name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokemon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

flavorText: A brutal Pokemon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

strengths: Rain Dance enables explosive turns with multiple energy attachments
Can power up attackers from zero to fully charged in one turn
100 HP is solid for a Stage 2
Hydro Pump can deal up to 60 damage
weaknesses: Lightning weakness is dangerous against Electabuzz/Zapdos
Rain Dance disabled by status conditions
counters: Electabuzz - Lightning type with efficient attacks
Energy Removal/Super Energy Removal - Disrupts energy buildup
Gust of Wind - Force Blastoise active before it's ready

competitiveHistory: Blastoise Rain Dance was one of the 'Big Three' decks of the original Base Set era, alongside Haymaker and Alakazam/Chansey. The ability to bypass energy attachment restrictions made it incredibly powerful and it remained competitive throughout the WotC era.

rulings.ruling: Rain Dance can be used multiple times per turn, attaching one Water Energy at a time.
Rain Dance can only attach Water Energy to Water-type Pokemon.
The Energy attached via Rain Dance is in addition to your normal Energy attachment for the turn.
